title: DOS-like font
content:
I am trying to ID this dos-like font. I have found many samples of fonts that are very similar, but yet off to some degree. I think because its a “system” font that it doesnt exist anywhere in a typical font format, and if not, then I was thinking surely there must be a new version made that emulates it? see picture (ignore circle) any help appreciated, thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090402214057im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FONT_4992.jpg)

 [‹ Any idea what typeface this is?](http://web.archive.org/web/20090402214057/http:/typophile.com/node/56351 "Go to previous forum topic") [ID help with Stering-like sans serif ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20090402214057/http:/typophile.com/node/56348 "Go to next forum topic")
author: wesmo

comments.content: Check out [Perfect DOS VGA 437](http://web.archive.org/web/20090402214057/http:/www.dafont.com/perfect-dos-vga-437.font). It’s not it, but will take you in the retro futuristic direction.
Frode, thanks for your suggestion. Yeah, there are a lot on DaFont that are close, but things are off, such as your suggestion has serifs which sorta throws it.
